preface.simpara: This specification describes the EHF CV. The document is part of Norwegian Agency for Public and Financial Management (DFØ) standardization work related to electronic commerce.

chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.simpara: Curriculum Vitaes (CV’s) are created in different ways and with different layouts both in procurement processes and other processes where CV’s are used. Contracting Authorities and Economic Operators must relate to different formats when describing skills and competences. This often leads to poor information quality and ambiguity which makes the evaluation of providers and candidates difficult and time consuming.

The purpose of this EHF-CV specification is to define and describe a common format for the Curriculum Vitae (CV) messages to be used in a procurement process. This includes both the tender process in Pre Award and the follow-up of contract information in Post Award.

section.title: Benefits
section.simpara: The main benefit with a standardized CV for both Contracting Authorities and Economic Operators is time saved when processing CV-information. A standardized CV will also enhance the procurement process by ensuring good quality of CV-information.
Benefits for Contracting Authoritites:

listitem.simpara: A standardized CV can save time and money through easier and faster specification of requirements and criteria
Content can be reused in CV-requests
Parts of the CV-process can be automated and AI may also be used in the process

section.simpara: Benefits for Economic Operators:

listitem.simpara: A standardized CV can save time and money through easier and faster specification of skills and competences
Content can be reused in CV’s
Parts of the CV-process can be automated and AI may also be used in the process

chapter.title: Parties and roles
chapter.simpara: The table below gives the definitions of the parties and roles involved in the EHF-CV process.

entry.simpara: The Contracting Authority (CA) is the organization within the government that is responsible for procurement, as well as the individual within that organization who has been delegated this responsibility.
Examples of CA roles: Sender of CV-request and Receiver of CV.
The Economic Operator (EO) is a business or other organisation which supplies goods, works or services within the context of market operations.
Examples of EO roles: Sender of CV and Receiver of CV-request.
The role is carried out by the Contracting authority.
The role is carried out by the Economic operator.
The role is carried out by the Economic operator.
The role is carried out by the Contracting authority.

chapter.simpara: The diagram below shows the roles in the EHF-CV process.

section.title: EHF-CV in Pre-Award
section.simpara: The following diagram illustrates the use of EHF-CV in a tender process in Pre-Award.

section.title: Tender process
section.simpara: This use case describes a tender process where a Contracting Authority needs several IT-developers to develop the company’s IT-system.

listitem.simpara: The Contracting Authority needs a developer to develop a web portal and specify criterias to be met. The Economic Operator provides a summary of the candidate’s experiences, academic background, skills, personal skills, language skills, references, interest, and personal information.
Contracting Authority Economic Operator
The Contracting Authority is able to prepare and send an EHF-CV Request
The Economic Operator is able to receive an EHF-CV Request and to prepare and send an EHF-CV
The Contracting Authority is able to receive an EHF-CV
The Contracting Authority creates a CV request document with all the necessary requirements and criteria.
The Contracting Authority sends an EHF-CV Request to the Economic Operators.
The Economic Operator colletcs CV-information for the relevant candidates based on the requirements.
The Economic Operator creates an EHF-CV and sends it to the Contracting Authority.
The Contracting Authority receives the EHF-CV.
The Contracting Authority rates EHF-CV’s from several Economic Operators and choose the best candidate based on the requested requirements.

section.title: EHF-CV in Post-Award
section.simpara: The following diagram illustrates the use of EHF-CV in a contract follow-up process in Post-Award.

section.title: Update of CV’s
section.simpara: This use case describes the update of CV-information after the contract is awarded.

listitem.simpara: The Economic Operator provides an update of the candidate’s skills or experiences. As an example this could be a new certification or a renewal of a certification. The update can be done regulary based on agreements in the contract or when a change has occured that affects the CV.
Contracting Authority Economic Operator
The Economic Operator is able to prepare and send an EHF-CV
The Contracting Authority is able to receive an EHF-CV
The Economic Operator creates an EHF-CV with updated CV-information and sends it to the Contracting Authority.
The Contracting Authority receives the EHF-CV with updated information and stores it as part of the contract.
The relevant CV’s are updated based on an EHF-CV sent from the Economic Operator to the Contracting Authority.

section.title: Parties
section.simpara: The following parties/roles may be specified in the message. The same actor may play more than one role depending on the handling routine.

section.title: Sender (SenderParty)
section.simpara: Sender is the sender of CV-request or CV.

formalpara.title: Example of sender in CV-request:

section.title: Receiver (ReceiverParty)
section.simpara: Receiver is the receiver of CV-request or CV.

formalpara.title: Example of receiver in CV-request:

section.title: Education
section.simpara: Education may be specified in CV request and CV to state the requirements and the level of education of the relevant candidates.

section.title: Information specific to CV request
section.simpara: A Contracting Authority can state both an educational requirement and an alternative requirement for the candidate. The alternative requirement is optional, but it might be relevant to accept other educations in some cases. The alternative requirements include the same information elements as the original requirement.
All educations need to be identified uniquely to ensure that the education can be referenced in the CV.

The element cv-req:Requirement shall be used to differentiate between educations that should and must be present. The Economic Operators will only provide qualified candidates to make it easier to do the rating.

formalpara.title: Example of the requested education in the CV request

callout.para: Education requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the educational requirement

formalpara.title: Example of the requested education in the CV request with alternative requirements

callout.para: Education requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the educational requirement
Registration type - specify which registration type candidate needs

section.simpara: In some cases the Contracting Authorities may accept relevant experiences as a compensation for an education degree. They will then state the type of experience and minimum years of experience. The following example illustrates that. In addition, there is also possible to have alternative educations.

formalpara.title: Example of the requested education in the CV request with relevant experience

callout.para: Education requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the educational requirement

section.title: Information specific to CV
section.simpara: Based on the educational requirement, the Economic Operator needs to document the candidate’s education.
The element cv:EducationReference needs to be used as a reference to the corresponding educational requirement in the CV request.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of education in CV as a response to requested education in CV request

callout.para: Registration number, connected to the registration type
Embedded document as binary object with mimeCode. Use Base64.
URI to education document, typically vitnemalsportalen in Norway
Contact information related to candidate’s education

section.title: Course and Certification
section.simpara: The course information group is used to state relevant courses that the candidate has taken. This information is not mandatory, but might be relevant for some assignments.
There is a difference between certification and course. Certification has an exam/test that needs to be passed, but not so for course.

section.title: Information specific to CV request
section.simpara: A Contracting Authority can state both a course/certification requirement (main requirement) and an alternative requirement in the CV request. The alternative requirement is optional, but in some cases other similar courses can be accepted. As an example the Contracting Authority can accept other versions of the specific course/certification. Note that the alternative requirements include the same information elements as the original requirement.

All courses and certifications need to be identified uniquely to ensure that the course can be referenced in the CV. The element cv-req:Requirement shall be used to differentiate between courses that should and must be present. The Economic Operators will only provide qualified candidates, and this makes it easier to do the rating.

A course/certification must include either the element cv-req:Type or cv-req:Title to identify the specific course or certification. Use type if the specific course is defined in the course code list, otherwise use the title. Similarly for certification.

In course requirement, the Contacting Authority can specify which period (cv-req:Period) the candidate must finish the course. This can be a date in the future. In a certification requirement the Contracting Authority can request that the certification must be valid to a specific date (cv-req:ValidTo).

formalpara.title: Example of the requested course in the CV request

callout.para: Course requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the course requirement

formalpara.title: Example of the requested course in the CV request with alternative requirement

callout.para: Course requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the course requirement

formalpara.title: Example of the requested certification in the CV request

callout.para: Certification requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the certification requirement
A date certification is valid to

formalpara.title: Example of the requested certification in the CV request with alternative requirement

callout.para: Certification requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the certification requirement
A date certification must be valid to

section.title: Information specific to CV
section.simpara: Based on the course/certification requirement, the Economic Operator needs to document the candidate’s course/certification. For CV used in the job application process, fill in the relevant parts of course/certification information.
The element cv:CourseReference and cv:CertificationReference must correspond to the course requirement in the CV request.

It is possible to state information about the supplier of the course/certification. This might be relevant for some Contracting Authorities, since different suppliers may offer the same course/certification with different content.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of course in CV as a response to requested course in CV request

callout.para: Information about the supplier of the course
Contact information of supplier expressed as email address
The country where the supplier is registered - expressed as country code from the code list
Embedded document as binary object with mimeCode. Use Base64.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of certification in CV as a response to requested course in CV request

callout.para: A date certification is valid to
Information about the supplier of the certification
Contact information of supplier expressed as email address
The country where the supplier is registered - expressed as country code from the code list
Embedded document as binary object with mimeCode. Use Base64.

section.title: Language skills
section.simpara: Language skills may be specified in CV request and CV. For certain assignments the language skill may be of great importance.

section.title: Information specific to CV request
section.simpara: A Contracting Authority can state both a specific language requirement and an alternative requirement. The alternative requirement is optional, but should be used if an alternative language is accepted. As an example some Norwegian entities use Norwegian as primarily work language but may accept Swedish and Danish. There is also possible to require several languages, for example Norwegian and English. Note that the alternative requirements include the same information elements as the original requirement.

All language skills need to be identified uniquely, to ensure that the language skill can be referenced in the CV. The element cv-req:Requirement shall be used to differentiate between languages skills that should and must be present.

Oral skill and written skill must be provided for each language skill requirement. The skill levels are based on EU global standard. Note that the skill level is a minimum requirement. For example, the Contracting Authority wants a candidate with a B1 oral skill level. The candidate has an oral skill level on A1, which implies that the candidate is qualified.

formalpara.title: Example of the requested language skill in the CV request

callout.para: Language skill requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the language requirement
A specific language - use code list

formalpara.title: Example of the requested language skill in the CV request with alternative requirements

callout.para: Language skill requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the language requirement
A specific language - use code list

section.title: Information specific to CV
section.simpara: Based on the language skill requirements, the Economic Operator needs to document the candidate’s language skills. Oral skill and written skill must be provided for each language. The skill levels must be defined according to the EU global standard code list.
The element cv:LanguageSkillsReference must contain reference to the corresponding language skill requirement in the CV request.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of language skill in CV as a response to requested language skill in CV request

callout.para: A specific language - use code list
Contact information related to candidate’s language skill

section.title: Project Experience
section.simpara: Project experience describes specific projects that the candidate has been a part of. Note that this is not the same as work experience.

section.title: Information specific to CV request
section.simpara: A Contracting Authority can specify a request for a project experience in several ways. For each project experience, there must be an experience type. In some cases it may be relevant to request project experience related to a specific industry, workplace (country) or sector.

The total years of experience can be specified in element cv-req:RequiredTotalExperience. It is also possible to specify a minimum number of years (cv-req:MinimumExperience) and a maximum number of years (cv-req:MaximumExperience). The candidate must fulfill the minimum requirement. Another option is to have either minimum or maximum years of project excperience.

In the CV request, the Contracting Authority can state the requested period for a project experience using element cv-req:Period. This implies that the candidate can only refer to project experience from this period. As an example a Contracting Authority may request information about project experience from the last five years.

The description of experience needs to be provided in element cv-req:ExperienceDescription, where the candidate’s role must be specified in element cv-req:Role. It is also possible to describe the project activities and candidate’s project position percent (e.g. must have worked 100% with the project).

The project value can be stated in element cv-req:ExperienceValue, where the Contracting Authority can specify the candidate’s project participation (need to be months), the size of project and the total value of the project.

formalpara.title: Example of the requested project experience in the CV request with alternative requirement

callout.para: Project experience requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the project requirement

formalpara.title: Example of the requested project experience in the CV request

para.programlisting: <cv-req:ProjectExperience> <cv-req:ID>1</cv-req:ID> <cv-req:Requirement>must</cv-req:Requirement> <cv-req:ExperienceType>1141101</cv-req:ExperienceType> <cv-req:IndustryType>01110</cv-req:IndustryType> <cv-req:Workplace>AI</cv-req:Workplace> <cv-req:JobSector>private</cv-req:JobSector> <cv-req:RequiredTotalExperience> <cv-req:MinimumExperience>2</cv-req:MinimumExperience> <cv-req:MaximumExperience>5</cv-req:MaximumExperience> </cv-req:RequiredTotalExperience> <cv-req:Period> <cv-req:StartDate>2020-01-19</cv-req:StartDate> <cv-req:EndDate>2020-10-02</cv-req:EndDate> </cv-req:Period> <cv-req:ExperienceDescription> <cv-req:PositionPercent>100</cv-req:PositionPercent> <cv-req:Role>1210178</cv-req:Role> <cv-req:Activities>Must have done financial analysis by using R.</cv-req:Activities> </cv-req:ExperienceDescription> <cv-req:ExperienceValue> <cv-req:ProjectParticipation>5</cv-req:ProjectParticipation> <cv-req:ProjectSize>5</cv-req:ProjectSize> <cv-req:ProjectValue currencyID="NOK">100</cv-req:ProjectValue> </cv-req:ExperienceValue> </cv-req:ProjectExperience>

callout.para: Project experience requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the project requirement

section.title: Information specific to CV
section.simpara: Based on the project experience requirement, the Economic Operator needs to document the candidate’s project experience. The element cv:EducationReference and cv:ProjectExperienceReference needs to be used in the procurement process, not in the job application process. The education reference corresponds to the educational requirement in the CV request when the contracting authority accepts relevant experience. The project experience reference corresponds to project experience in the CV request.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of project experience in CV as a response to requested education in CV request

para.programlisting: <cv:ProjectExperience> <cv:ID>1</cv:ID> <cv:ExperienceType>2130111</cv:ExperienceType> <cv:CompanyParty> <cv:EndpointID scheme="0192">123456785</cv:EndpointID> <cv:Name>AZ company</cv:Name> </cv:CompanyParty> <cv:Period> <cv:StartDate>2005-01-01</cv:StartDate> <cv:EndDate>2018-12-01</cv:EndDate> </cv:Period> <cv:ExperienceDescription> <cv:PositionPercent>100</cv:PositionPercent> <cv:Role>2130110</cv:Role> <cv:Activities>Coordinator of web portal for X company.</cv:Activities> </cv:ExperienceDescription> <cv:ExperienceValue> <cv:ProjectParticipation>5</cv:ProjectParticipation> <cv:ProjectSize>20</cv:ProjectSize> <cv:ProjectValue currencyID="NOK">1500000</cv:ProjectValue> </cv:ExperienceValue> <cv:Contact> <cv:Name>Ola Nordmann</cv:Name> <cv:Role>2130121</cv:Role> <cv:Telephone>22221111</cv:Telephone> <cv:ElectronicMail>ola.nordmann@x-company.no</cv:ElectronicMail> </cv:Contact> <cv:EducationReference> <cv:ID>req-edu-45</cv:ID> </cv:EducationReference> <cv:ProjectExperienceReference> <cv:ID>req-25</cv:ID> </cv:ProjectExperienceReference> </cv:ProjectExperience>

callout.para: Information about contracting authority or organisation
Project experience description: position percent, role, activities
Value of project experience: total month of project participation, total project size, total project value

section.title: Work Experience
section.simpara: Work experience contains information about a candidate’s employment history. This is not the same as project experience.

section.title: Information specific to CV request
section.simpara: A Contracting Authority can specify a request for a work experience in several ways. For each work experience there must be a position level, i.e. employee, middle level manager or manager to illustrate the type of experience a candidate needs for the assignment.
It is also possible to request a work experience specific to a industry or workplace. The job sector need to be specified for each work experience in element cv-req:JobSector, e.g. "private".

The minimum total experience must be specified in element cv-req:MinimumTotalExperience. This implies that the candidate must fulfill this requirement and it can be used to differentiate a junior from a senior candidate.

In the CV request, the Contracting Authority can state the requested period for a work experience in element cv-req:Period. This implies that the candidate can only refer to work experience from this period, for example work experience from the last seven years.

The description of experience need to be provided in element cv-req:WorkExperienceDescription, where candidate’s role must be specified in element cv-req:Role. It is also possible to describe the project activities and candidate’s position percent (e.g. must have worked 100%, full-time, with the project).

formalpara.title: Example of the requested work experience in the CV request with alternative requirement

para.programlisting: <cv-req:WorkExperience> <cv-req:ID>1</cv-req:ID> <cv-req:Requirement>should</cv-req:Requirement> <cv-req:PositionLevel>employee</cv-req:PositionLevel> <cv-req:IndustryType>71200</cv-req:IndustryType> <cv-req:Workplace>AI</cv-req:Workplace> <cv-req:JobSector>private</cv-req:JobSector> <cv-req:MinimumTotalExperience>5</cv-req:MinimumTotalExperience> <cv-req:Period> <cv-req:StartDate>2010-01-19</cv-req:StartDate> <cv-req:EndDate>2020-10-02</cv-req:EndDate> </cv-req:Period> <cv-req:WorkExperienceDescription> <cv-req:PositionPercent>100</cv-req:PositionPercent> <cv-req:Role>2130161</cv-req:Role> <cv-req:Activities>Must have done mathemathical analysis by using Python.</cv-req:Activities> </cv-req:WorkExperienceDescription> <cv-req:AlternativeWorkExperience> <cv-req:ID>1</cv-req:ID> <cv-req:Requirement>should</cv-req:Requirement> <cv-req:PositionLevel>employee</cv-req:PositionLevel> <cv-req:IndustryType>72190</cv-req:IndustryType> <cv-req:Workplace>AI</cv-req:Workplace> <cv-req:JobSector>private</cv-req:JobSector> <cv-req:MinimumTotalExperience>5</cv-req:MinimumTotalExperience> <cv-req:Period> <cv-req:StartDate>2010-01-19</cv-req:StartDate> <cv-req:EndDate>2020-10-02</cv-req:EndDate> </cv-req:Period> <cv-req:WorkExperienceDescription> <cv-req:PositionPercent>100</cv-req:PositionPercent> <cv-req:Role>2130161</cv-req:Role> <cv-req:Activities>Must have done mathemathical analysis by using Python.</cv-req:Activities> </cv-req:WorkExperienceDescription> </cv-req:AlternativeWorkExperience> </cv-req:WorkExperience>

callout.para: Work experience requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the work experience requirement

formalpara.title: Example of the requested work experience in the CV request

para.programlisting: <cv-req:WorkExperience> <cv-req:ID>1</cv-req:ID> <cv-req:Requirement>must</cv-req:Requirement> <cv-req:PositionLevel>MiddleLevelManager</cv-req:PositionLevel> <cv-req:IndustryType>01230</cv-req:IndustryType> <cv-req:Workplace>AI</cv-req:Workplace> <cv-req:JobSector>private</cv-req:JobSector> <cv-req:MinimumTotalExperience>5</cv-req:MinimumTotalExperience> <cv-req:Period> <cv-req:StartDate>2020-01-19</cv-req:StartDate> <cv-req:EndDate>2020-10-02</cv-req:EndDate> </cv-req:Period> <cv-req:WorkExperienceDescription> <cv-req:PositionPercent>100</cv-req:PositionPercent> <cv-req:Role>1234106</cv-req:Role> <cv-req:Activities>Must have done mathemathical analysis by using Python.</cv-req:Activities> </cv-req:WorkExperienceDescription> </cv-req:WorkExperience>

callout.para: Work experience requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the work experience requirement

section.title: Information specific to CV
section.simpara: Based on the project experience requirement, the Economic Operator needs to document the candidate’s work experience. The element cv:EducationReference and cv:WorkExperienceReference needs to be used. The education reference corresponds to the educational requirement in the CV request when the Contracting Authority accepts relevant experience. The work experience in the CV must correspond to the work experience in the CV request.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of work in CV as a response to requested education in CV request

para.programlisting: <cv:WorkExperience> <cv:ID>3</cv:ID> <cv:PositionLevel>employee</cv:PositionLevel> <cv:CompanyParty> <cv:EndpointID scheme="0192">123456785</cv:EndpointID> <cv:Name>X company</cv:Name> </cv:CompanyParty> <cv:Period> <cv:StartDate>2013-05-05</cv:StartDate> <cv:EndDate>2017-08-01</cv:EndDate> </cv:Period> <cv:WorkExperienceDescription> <cv:PositionPercent>100</cv:PositionPercent> <cv:Role>2130161</cv:Role> <cv:Activities>Mathemathical analysis by using R and Python.</cv:Activities> </cv:WorkExperienceDescription> <cv:Contact> <cv:Name>Ola Nordmann</cv:Name> <cv:Role>1222169</cv:Role> <cv:Telephone>22221111</cv:Telephone> <cv:ElectronicMail>ola.nordmann@x.no</cv:ElectronicMail> </cv:Contact> <cv:EducationReference> <cv:ID>req-edu-45</cv:ID> </cv:EducationReference> <cv:WorkExperienceReference> <cv:ID>req-25</cv:ID> </cv:WorkExperienceReference> </cv:WorkExperience>

callout.para: Information about contracting authority or organisation
Work experience description: position percent, role, activities

section.title: Skills
section.simpara: Skills contains information about candidate’s abilities related to the specific work.

section.title: Information specific to CV request
section.simpara: A Contracting Authority can specify a skill requirement and an alternative requirement in the CV request. The alternative requirement is optional, but may be used when different skills can be accepted.

The element cv-req:Requirement shall be used to differentiate between skills that should and must be present. The Economic Operators will only provide qualified candidates, and this makes it easier to do the rating.

A skill must include either cv-req:Type or cv-req:Title, not both. Use type if the specific skill is defined in the skill code list, otherwise use the title. Each skill can consist of a version number.

The Contracting Authority can specify details about the skill practices in element cv-req:SkillPractice. The element contains information about the last practiced date, the skill practice length (minimum requirement - must be stated as months) and if the candidate must provide a reference person (element cv-req:SkillsReference is true).

formalpara.title: Example of the requested skill in the CV request

callout.para: Skill requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the skill requirement

formalpara.title: Example of the requested skill in the CV request with alternative requirement

callout.para: Skill requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the skill requirement

section.title: Information specific to CV
section.simpara: Based on the skill requirement, the Economic Operator needs to document the candidate’s skill. The element cv:SkillsReference must be used as a reference to the corresponding skill requirement in the CV request.
References to where the skill has been applied can be stated in element cv:SkillsAppliedReference/cv:ID. For example education, project experience, etc.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of skill in CV as a response to requested skill in CV request

callout.para: Reference to where the skill is applied

section.title: Clearance
section.simpara: Jobs within certain departments of the government or private sectors require that employees have a specific level of clearance. For example are security clearances required by the government employers who have access to sensitive information.

section.title: Information specific to CV request
section.simpara: A Contracting Authority can state clearance requirement (main requirement) and an alternative requirement in the CV request. The alternative requirement is optional, but may be used when an alternative clearance can be accepted.

All clearances need to be identified uniquely to ensure that the clearance can be referenced to in the CV. The element cv-req:Requirement shall be used to state if the clerarance should or must be present. The Economic Operators will only provide qualified candidates, and this makes it easier to do the rating.
A clearance must include either element cv-req:Type or cv-req:Title, not both. Use type if the specific clearance is defined in the clearance code list, otherwise use the title.

Contracting Authorities must specify the level of clearance (cv-req:Level), by using code list clearance level. Note that the clearance level is a minimum requirement, which means candidate with higher level of clearance is qualified.

We often need a candidate that has active clearance through the whole job period. The Contracting Authority must specify an expiration date (cv-req:ExpirationDate), which defines the time period the clearance needs to be active.

formalpara.title: Example of the requested clearance in the CV request

callout.para: Clearance requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the clearance requirement

formalpara.title: Example of the requested clearance in the CV request with alternative requirement

callout.para: Clearance requirement - indicate whether a candidate needs to fulfill the clearance requirement

section.title: Information specific to CV
section.simpara: Based on the clearance requirement, the Economic Operator needs to document the candidate’s clearance. The element cv:ClearanceReference must be used as a reference to the corresponding clearance requirement in the CV request.
The documentation of clearance can be stated as URI (cv:URI) or embedded document (cv:EmbeddedDocumentBinaryObject).
Candidates who don’t fulfill the clearance requirement can describe the reason and whether this can be done before the job period. Use element cv:Description.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of clearance in CV as a response to requested course in CV request

callout.para: Embedded document as binary object with mimeCode. Use Base64.

section.title: Personal Skills
section.simpara: Person skills contains information about a candidates abilities and strength.

section.title: Information specific to CV request
section.simpara: A Contracting Authority can state personal skill requirement (main requirement) in the CV request.
All personal skills need to be identified uniquely to ensure that the personal skill can be referenced in the CV.
A personal skill must include either element cv-req:Type or cv-req:Title. Use type if the specific personal skill is defined in the person skill code list, otherwise use the title.

formalpara.title: Example of the requested clearance in the CV request

section.title: Information specific to CV
section.simpara: Based on the personal skill requirement, the economic operator needs to provide information of the candidate’s personal skill. For CV used in the job application process, fill in the relevant parts of personal skill information.

The element cv:PersonalSkillsReference needs to be used in the procurement process, not in the job application process. This is a reference to the corresponding personal skill requirement in the CV request.

There is possible to state a contact point (to a person) who can confirm the candidate’s personal skills, use the element cv:Contact. In some cases, there is relevant that the contracting authority needs this confirmation or documentation from an earlier co-worker, leader, team leader, etc.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of personal skill in CV as a response to requested course in CV request

section.title: References
section.simpara: References that can testify the applicant’s character, skills and abilities to a Contracting Authority.

section.title: Information specific to CV request
section.simpara: The Contracting Authority can require a minimum total references in element cv-req:MinimumTotalReference.

formalpara.title: Example of the requested reference in the CV request

section.title: Information specific to CV
section.simpara: Based on the reference requirement, the Economic Operator needs to document the candidate’s references.
The element cv:RequestReference must be used as a reference to the corresponding reference requirement in the CV request.

Party information need to be stated in element cv:Party, with the party name and electronic address identifier. Relationship between the candidate and the reference-person can be stated in element cv:Relationship. For example school teacher, team leader, etc.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of skill in CV as a response to requested skill in CV request

section.title: Personal Information
section.simpara: Personal details about the applicant. Is only used in CV and not in CV request.

Social media must include either element cv-req:Type or cv-req:Title to identify type of sosial media. Use type if the specific social media is defined in the clearance code list, otherwise use the title.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of personal skill in a CV

section.title: Interest
section.simpara: An applicant’s personal interest. Is only used in CV and not in CV request.
Information about applicant’s hobbies and interests can be described in element cv:Description.

formalpara.title: Example of a description of interest in a CV

section.title: Additional Information
section.simpara: May be used for additional information about the applicant, not provided in other information groups in. Only used in CV, not in CV request.

Give a short title of additional information in element cv:Title and describe the information in element cv:Description. Documentation of the information can be stated as a URI (cv:URI) and/or embedded document (cv:EmbeddedDocumentBinaryObject).

formalpara.title: Example of a description of additional information in a CV

callout.para: Embedded document as binary object with mimeCode. Use Base64.

appendix.title: Profiles and messages
appendix.simpara: All messages contains ProfileID and CustomizationID. ProfileID identifies what business process a given message is part of, and CustomizationID identifies the kind of message and the rules applied.
Profiles are connected to one business process, and may contain multiple document types. Valid document instances shall contain corresponding ProfileID and CustomizationID.

important.simpara: CustomizationID is a string without spaces. The list below contains spaces in CustomizationID to make them easier to read. Make sure to remove any spaces before use.

section.title: Customization and Profile identifiers
section.simpara: In the table below you will find the values to be used as the specification identifier and the business process type for this profile

appendix.title: Semantic datatypes
appendix.simpara: Semantic data types are used to bridge the gap between the semantic concepts expressed by the information elements and the technical implementation. The semantic data types define the allowed value domain for the content, and any additional information components (attributes) needed in order to ensure its precise interpretation.

section.title: Primitive types
section.simpara: Semantic data type content may be of the following primitive types. These primitive types were taken from {ISO15000}, Annex A.

entry.simpara: A set of finite-length sequences of binary digits.
Time point representing a calendar day on a time scale consisting of an origin and a succession of calendar {ISO8601}.
A subset of the real numbers, which can be represented by decimal numerals.

section.title: Semantic data types
section.simpara: The different semantic data types are described in the tables below, where various features such as attributes, format, and decimals as well as the basic type are defined for each semantic data type. They are based on {ISO15000}.

When used in an instance document, each data element will contain data. In the below tables this is identified as the “content”. Whenever a business term is used this term shall always have content and therefore the content is always mandatory.

section.title: Percentage
section.simpara: Percentages are given as fractions of a hundred (per cent) e.g. the value 34,78 % in percentage terms is given as 34,78.

important.simpara: No restriction on number of decimals for percentages.

section.title: Quantity
section.simpara: Quantities are used to state a number of units such as for items. The code for the Unit of Measure is defined as a separate business term.

important.simpara: No restriction on number of decimals for quantities.

section.title: Code
section.simpara: Codes are used to specify allowed values in elements as well as for lists of options. Code is different from Identifier in that allowed values have standardized meanings that can be known by the recipient.

important.simpara: Codes shall be entered exactly as shown in the selected code list

section.title: Identifier
section.simpara: Identifiers (IDs) are keys that are issued by the sender or recipient of a document or by a third party.

important.simpara: The use of the attributes is specified for each information element.

section.title: Date
section.simpara: Dates shall be in accordance to the “Calendar date complete representation” as specified by {ISO8601}, format YYYY-MM-DD.

important.simpara: Dates shall not include timezone information.

section.title: Document Reference
section.simpara: Document Reference Types are identifiers that were assigned to a document or document line.

section.title: Text
section.simpara: Text is the actual wording of anything written or printed. Line breaks in the text may be present, and any line breaks should be preserved and respected by the receiver’s system

section.title: Binary objects
section.simpara: Binary objects can be used to describe files which are transmitted together with the business document. Attachments shall be transmitted together with the business document. The binary object has two supplementary components: a Mime Code, which specifies the Mime type of the attachment and a Filename that is provided by (or on behalf of) the sender of the business document.

section.title: Boolean
section.simpara: Boolean indicators are used to specify the two allowed values, true or false. All elements of datatype Boolean, must have either true or false as their value.
